\[ \qquad \lim_{x\to a}\dfrac{x^n-a^n}{x-a} = n\cdot a^{n-1} \] The above results holds under the following two conditions
% \begin{align} \begin{tabular}{MMM}
\hline n & a & \text{Example} \\ \hline n\in\mathbb{Z}^+ & \text{Anything} & \lim_{x\to a}\dfrac{x^5-a^5}{x-a} = 5\cdot a^4\\ \hline n\in\mathbb{Q}& a > 0& \lim_{x\to a}\dfrac{x^{\frac{1}{3}}-a^{\frac{1}{3}}}{x-a} = \frac{1}{3}\cdot a^{-\frac{2}{3}}\\ \hline \end{tabular} \end{align} %text where $\mathbb{Z}^+$ is the set of \underline\text{positive integers} and $\mathbb{Q}$ is the set of \underline\text{rational numbers} (things like $\frac{3}{4}, -\frac{7}{5}$ etc.)%
